content.question:
A fast-food restaurant claims that a small order of french fries contains 120 calories. A nutritionist is concerned that the true average calorie count is higher than that. The nutritionist randomly selects 35 small orders of french fries and determines their calories. The resulting sample mean is 155.6 calories, and the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value for the hypothesis test is 0.00093.
Which of the following is a correct interpretation of the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value?

choices.label: If the population mean is 120 calories, the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.00093 is the probability of observing a sample mean of 155.6 calories or more.

If the population mean is 120 calories, the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.00093 is the probability of observing a sample mean of 155.6 calories or less.

If the population mean is 120 calories, the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.00093 is the probability of observing a sample mean of 155.6 calories or more, or a sample mean of 84.4 calories or less.

If the population mean is 155.6 calories, the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.00093 is the probability of observing a sample mean of 120 calories or more.

If the population mean is 155.6 calories, the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.00093 is the probability of observing a sample mean of 120 calories or less.

content.answer: If the population mean is 120 calories, the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.00093 is the probability of observing a sample mean of 155.6 calories or more.

topic.text: 7.5: Carrying Out a Test for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
